abstract.p: In this paper we study two families of functions $F_e$ and $F_o$, and show how to approximate the functions in the interval $\lbrack-1, 1\rbrack$. The functions are assumed to be real when the argument is real. We define $$F_e = \{f: f(-x) = f(x), f(1) = 0, f \in L^2\lbrack-1, 1\rbrack\}$$ and $$F_o = \{f: f(-x) = -f(x), f(1) = 0, f \in L^2\lbrack-1, 1\rbrack\}.$$ Let further $\mathscr{P}_m$ be the set of all real polynomials of degree not higher than $m$ such that the polynomials belong to the set $F_e$ if $m$ is even and to the set $F_o$ if $m$ is odd. We determine the least squares approximation for the function $f \in F_e$ (or $F_o$) in the class $\mathscr{P}_{2n}$ (or $\mathscr{P}_{2n + 1}$), with respect to the norm $\|f\| = ((f, f))^{1/2}$, where the inner product is defined by $(f, g) = \int^1_{-1}f(x)g(x)w(x)dx$, with $f, g \in L^2\lbrack-1, 1\rbrack = L^2_w\lbrack-1, 1\rbrack$ and $w(x) = (1 - x^2)^{\lambda - 1/2}$. We also consider the general case when $f$ is neither an even nor an odd function but $f \in L^2\lbrack-1, 1\rbrack$ and $f(-1) = f(1) = 0$. Using the theory of Gegenbauer polynomials we obtain the approximating polynomials in the form $$\phi_{2n}(x) = \sum^n_{k = 1} d_{n,k}(1 - x{^2)^k}\quad \text{when}\quad f \in F_e$$ and $$\phi_{2n + 1}(x) = x \sum^n_{k = 1} e_{n,k}(1 - x{^2)^k}\quad \text{when}\quad f \in F_o.$$ We apply the general theory to the functions $f(x) = \cos(\pi x/2)$ and $f(x) = J_0(a_0x)$, where $a_0 = \{\min x > 0: J_0(x) = 0\}$.
